description: Chives (Allium 'Chivette') are a herbaceous perennial famed for their culinary uses, appeal and mild onion flavor. In the garden they form very attractive clumps of glossy, grass-like blue-green foliage and star-shaped, purple flowers that bloom in summer. The flower and foliage have a wonderful scent and attract beneficial insects. Chivette is a relatively pest and disease-free, low maintenance ornamental and edible, withstanding even cold winters. In the kitchen, the leaves can be snipped and used in salads, sauces, and other dishes. Plant your chives in a sunny spot and enjoy sweet-smelling foliage that's delicious too!
